intro: Arnebia euchroma, commonly known as Indian madder, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas and parts of South Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant produces small, clustered pink to red flowers during the summer months. Its roots are the primary part used, containing pigments such as rubiadin, which have been traditionally used in dyeing fabrics. The plant is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional systems of medicine.
